page.title: 08CAMBERLEY HEATH GOLF COURSE.
page.content: Camberley Heath is an 18 hole course & is 6,400 yards long.It is a champion -ship licenced course & is privately owned by a committee.The secretary is Mr. Harris & the professional is Mr. Graham Everett. The course was formed in the Edwardian period.Mr Colt desig- ned the course & he opened it in 1913. It was the most expensive golf club to be built in the world.The course, site & buildings cost over Â£15,000. It was owned at that time by F.Gomer. He also owned Waterers, a flower centre near Bagshot & he lived in Fimley Hall, now a hotel.The clubhouse was designed & built by H.Reginald Poulter.It cost Â£4000 & the grass seed bill sent from Suttons was Â£600.In 1931 the Prince of Wales & the Duke of York played a game of golf here.The Prince was so pleased he gave the club a special clock.The course is very famous and popular.
